casebody.data:
INTERSAL, INC.
v.
HAMILTON, et al. 115PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. January 23, 2019 David H. Harris, Jr., Attorney at Law, Durham, for Intersal, Inc. Brian Rabinovitz, Special Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Charles G. Whitehead, Special Deputy Attorney General, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, for North Carolina Department of Natural and Cultural Resources, et al. Jeffrey A. Doyle, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Joshua D. Neighbors, Attorney at Law, for Friends of Queen Anne's Revenge (Non-Profit Corporation).

*412The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 23rd of January 2019 by State Defendants:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 23rd of January 2019."

State Defendants shall have up to and including the 15th day of February 2019 to file and serve his/ her brief with this Court.
